The claim was made by U: S. Rep. Veronica Escobar, a Democrat from El Paso, Texas, during her response to President Donald Trump's State of the Union Address on Feb. 4, 2020. This establishes the source of the claim.
Escobar: s spokesperson defined a bill as bipartisan if it had "at least one Republican vote on the House floor" or if it was passed by a voice vote and "has at least one Republican cosponsor." This definition of bipartisanship was used to determine which bills were included in the claim.
Political experts consulted for the anal: s definition of bipartisanship was relatively low, as it included bills with minimal or single Republican support. This perspective provides context for evaluating the authenticity of the claim.
